title: Nurseries in England bring in Covid-style protocols as measles cases rise
description: Staff deploy infection controls and step up cleaning as cases pass 500 for year to date and after one child dies
content:
Parents and experts have voiced alarm over rising measles cases, with nurseries bringing in Covid-style isolation protocols to clamp down on outbreaks.
There have been more than 500 confirmed cases in England in 2025, the majority in young children. ... [4984 chars]

title: Detective who helped catch 'sadistic' serial killer Peter Tobin believes there are more victims out there
description: Peter Tobin's secret reign of terror was unveiled following the disappearance of Polish student Angelika Kluk in September 2006.
content:
What started as a missing person case led to the capture of an "evil" serial killer who "got sadistic sexual pleasure" from murdering women.
Peter Tobin died in October 2022 at the age of 76 while serving three life sentences for the murders of Angel... [14309 chars]

title: Syria presidency to send new force to halt clashes in south
description: The Syrian leader's move comes after days of clashes between Bedouin and Druze fighters in Suweida, reported to have killed hundreds.
content:
In a post on X, ambassador Tom Barrack said that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Sharaa "have agreed to a ceasefire" embraced by Syria's neighbours Turkey and Jordan.
"We call upon Druze, Bedouins, and Sunnis to put down their weapons a... [2085 chars]

title: US justice department asks to unseal grand jury transcripts in Epstein case
description: Move seeks to contain controversy that has engulfed Trump administration since it announced it would not release more files from sex trafficking case
content:
The US Department of Justice asked a federal court on Friday to unseal grand jury transcripts in Jeffrey Epstein’s case at the direction of Donald Trump amid a firestorm over the administration’s handling of records related to the wealthy financier.

title: Parkinson's cycling: How it gave me my independence back
description: Tony Deeney was diagnosed with Parkinson's 23 years ago but cycling has helped him rediscover his independence.
content:
Tony Deeney was diagnosed with Parkinson's at just 38 and the degenerative condition gradually left feeling isolated and with little enthusiasm for life.
But after two decades struggling with the condition, he says cycling has helped him rediscover a... [692 chars]
